newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Colly Cotton debuts at 11 pct premium.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Colly Cotton debuts at 11 pct premium.

text.p: Shares of Colly Cotton Ltd debuted at an 11 percent premium to the issue price of A$1.00 when they opened at A$1.11 on the Australian Stock Exchange on Thursday.
The listing follows a A$107 million initial public share offer which closed oversubscribed on October 9.
Colly Cotton, based in northwestern New South Wales, is one of Australia's largest integrated cotton production, ginning and marketing companies.
The company's prospectus forecasted a net profit of A$21.4 million for the year to June 30, 1997 and a full year dividend of 9.7 cents.
Colly Cotton's major shareholders are four Australian government superannuation (pension) funds which previously owned the company and now retain a 25 percent stake.
Colly Cotton reported on Thursday that it had completed its 1996/97 planting of 24,700 hectares of cotton.
The company harvested 133,500 bales of cotton in the 1996 season and expects to harvest 192,000 bales in 1997.
Colly Cotton has a 9.5 percent stake in Naomi Cotton Co-operative, Australia's largest cotton ginner.
